title: Are the Harry Potter books better, and should I get them? - Quora

response.answer_text: Better For You I Have A eBook collection Link:Harry Potter - Google Drive I would say I really loved them though I'm not much of a reader myself. It's the 1st ever novel I read and I enjoyed reading it. And in comparison to the movies, I'll like to say the books are a million times more fun. The movies don't seem to be luring you into the franchise. In a general view the movies are really fun and enjoyable, but if you ever read the books you'd know how stupid they are. Those pages you turn with a heavy heart knowing that someone is going to die. So Yeah go get them

If you are someone who loves to read books in general, Harry Potter series is something that you should not afford to miss reading in your lifetime. It's not only the Harry potter series, any book that has been filmed will miss out something or the other. For those who straightly watch the movie, it may be wonderful and satisfying. But when you read a book and watch the same movie, you'll know how much the movie misses out. The book order of phoenix was bigger than the deathly hallows book. Deathly hallows had 2 parts in the movie, because they cannot finish it in a single movie. Whereas the order of phoenix was as single movie, because they chose to leave out a lot of detailing. And they modify certain parts that they think would reduce the screen time. For example, Hagrid only takes Harry and Hermione to meet his brother Gawrp the first time in the book , since Ron will be playing Quidditch. In the movie, the entire sequence of Ron playing Quidditch, the famous “Weasley is our king” chants would have been ignored. However, the core plot was delivered to the audience. That's how the movies work. I'd suggest anyone to read the Harry Potter book series for this very reason. There are wonderfully small detailings included in the book by J.K.Rowling. Try it and you won't regret it 😄 #WeasleyIsOurKing !

Sorry, didn’t know they were ill. But if they were, I would certainly hope they are better. Better than what: films, blogs, Pinterest? They are an excellent series that depict a coming of age story and juxtaposes the ‘battle’ of between good and evil. There are a few glitches/errors in the universe that JK Rowling created but altogether an enjoyable read at almost any age. They do cost money and for my part would suggest reading library copies first. I only purchase books that I would want to read more than once, (unfortunately that’s a lot of books), but have discovered the joys of Kindle for keeping those re-reads from needlessly cluttering up my shelves.

The books are way more detailed, fun, exciting, and have much more content than the movies. If you have watched the movies, then reading the books will be much more fun and easier, This is because while reading, we can simply paint the picture of teh scene inside our head and it makes it easier to perceive as to what is going on. I highly recommend you to give them a try. If you liked what you read, kindly message me and I could provide you the link to buy them. Would not affect you but would help me out a bit. :) Regards

Better than what? Personally I dislike them. I didn’t read but a couple of pages before I realized that Rowling had “borrowed” elements from other writers. To me, that ruins a book. It’s a good thing she wrote for children/youth, who probably hadn’t read any of the books she “borrowed” from and so didn’t care. Admittedly, she appeals to a lot of youngsters.

Yes, they are better than the movies BY FAR. The movies tell the story in the most shallow way possible and miss many of the central messages of the books. The films also butcher all of the charaters! Honestly, until you read the books, you won’t understand what I mean. So, please do read them!
